meanings.def: to tear something or to become torn, often suddenly or violently
examples: rip (something) I ripped my jeans on the fence.
The flags had been ripped in two.
The nail ripped a hole in my jacket.
I heard the tent rip.
rip something + adj. She ripped the letter open.
He ripped open the plastic bag.
I ripped my coat on a nail.

meanings.def: to remove something quickly or violently, often by pulling it
examples: He ripped off his tie.
The carpet had been ripped from the stairs.
Half of the house was ripped away in the explosion.

meanings.def: to copy sound or video files from a website or CD on to a computer
to change text or images into a form in which they can be displayed on a screen or printed
to go or allow something such as a car to go as fast as possible
examples: Once on the open road, he let rip.
Come on Steve—let her rip.

meanings.def: to do something or to allow something to happen as fast as possible
examples: This would cause inflation to let rip again.

meanings.def: to speak or do something with great force, enthusiasm, etc. and without control
examples: When she gets angry with her boyfriend, she really lets rip at him.
The group let rip with a single from their new album.

meanings.def: to destroy something; to criticize somebody very strongly
examples: countries ripped apart by fighting
The dog had ripped a cushion to shreds.
The hounds fell on the fox and ripped it apart.
She'll rip you to pieces if you try to keep her cub from her.

meanings.def: to destroy the most important part or aspect of something
examples: Closing the factory tore the heart out of the community.
